War of the Ring.outcome: Sauron's defeat and the end of the Third Age
War of the Ring.summary: The final conflict against Sauron in which the Free Peoples of Middle-earth unite to destroy the One Ring and overthrow the Dark Lord.

Battle of Helm's Deep.summary: The siege of the Hornburg in Rohan, where Théoden's riders and their allies withstand Saruman's army of Uruk-hai until Gandalf arrives with reinforcements.

Battle of Pelennor Fields.outcome: Sauron's armies routed before Minas Tirith
Battle of Pelennor Fields.summary: The great battle outside Minas Tirith in which the forces of Gondor and Rohan, aided by Aragorn, defeat Sauron's hosts and the Witch-king of Angmar is slain.

Battle at the Black Gate.outcome: Diversion succeeds as the Ring is destroyed
Battle at the Black Gate.summary: A desperate assault led by Aragorn at the Morannon to distract Sauron and draw his Eye away from Frodo and Sam in Mordor.

War of Wrath.summary: The final war of the First Age in which the Valar and the hosts of the West overthrow Morgoth and destroy much of Beleriand.

War of the Elves and Sauron.outcome: Sauron driven from Eriador but not destroyed
War of the Elves and Sauron.summary: The conflict sparked by Sauron's attempt to dominate the Elves through the Rings of Power, culminating in the sack of Eregion and the intervention of Númenor.

War of the Last Alliance.outcome: Sauron defeated and the One Ring taken by Isildur
War of the Last Alliance.summary: The great war in which the Elves and Men under Gil-galad and Elendil besiege and defeat Sauron in Mordor at the end of the Second Age.

Battle of Five Armies.outcome: Defeat of the goblins and wargs of the North
Battle of Five Armies.summary: The battle at the Lonely Mountain fought between Dwarves, Elves, Men and their enemies after the death of Smaug.

Wars of Beleriand.outcome: Progressive destruction of the Elvish kingdoms by Morgoth until the War of Wrath
Wars of Beleriand.summary: A series of major conflicts in Beleriand between the forces of Morgoth and the Elves and their allies throughout the First Age.

War of the Ring (indirect).outcome: Sauron's defeat and the end of the Third Age
War of the Ring (indirect).summary: Used for characters whose role in the War of the Ring is indirect or primarily background, while still being shaped by its events.
